item.title: Opioid Overdoses: Mass Casualty Zones In America
item.description:
June 20, 2017 - Last year alone, more Americans died from drug overdoses than were lost fighting the war in Vietnam.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-20/opioid-epidemic-placeholder-headline

item.title: 6 Members Of The Presidential Advisory Council On HIV/Aids Resign
item.description: June 20, 2017 - Steve Inskeep talks to Dr. Michelle Ogle of the Warren-Vance Community Health Center in Henderson, N.C., about why she chose to resign from the advisory council. Five others also left the panel.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - Steve Inskeep talks to Dr. Michelle Ogle of the Warren-Vance Community Health Center in Henderson, N.C., about why she chose to resign from the advisory council. Five others also left the panel. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/20/533617483/6-members-of-the-presidential-advisory-council-on-hiv-aids-resign

item.title: Study Finds Yoga Can Help Back Pain, But Keep It Gentle, With These Poses
item.description: June 20, 2017 - A yoga class designed specifically for lower back pain can be as effective as physical therapy in easing pain, the study says. The class and teacher manuals are available online, for free.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - A yoga class designed specifically for lower back pain can be as effective as physical therapy in easing pain, the study says. The class and teacher manuals are available online, for free. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/20/533505211/study-finds-yoga-can-help-back-pain-but-keep-it-gentle-with-these-poses

item.title: When Sleeping In The Car Is The Price Of A Doctor Visit
item.description: June 20, 2017 - The Remote Area Medical charity holds dozens of free health clinics each year. Low-income patients waited in their cars and on blankets for the clinic to open one recent Saturday morning.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - The Remote Area Medical charity holds dozens of free health clinics each year. Low-income patients waited in their cars and on blankets for the clinic to open one recent Saturday morning. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/20/533210947/when-sleeping-in-the-car-is-the-price-of-a-doctor-visit

item.title: Alaska Governor Raises Concerns About Republican Health Care Efforts
item.description: June 19, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish speaks with Alaska Gov. Bill Walker about his concerns with the American Health Care Act. With its remote rural communities, Alaska has some of the highest insurance costs in the country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish speaks with Alaska Gov. Bill Walker about his concerns with the American Health Care Act. With its remote rural communities, Alaska has some of the highest insurance costs in the country. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/19/533556278/alaska-governor-raises-concerns-about-republican-health-care-efforts

item.title: Senate Democrats Stage Stand-Off Over GOP Health Care Efforts
item.description: June 19, 2017 - Senate Republicans have two weeks to meet a self-imposed deadline to vote on a health care bill. Democrats and several Republicans are criticizing the closed-door process for drafting the legislation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - Senate Republicans have two weeks to meet a self-imposed deadline to vote on a health care bill. Democrats and several Republicans are criticizing the closed-door process for drafting the legislation. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/19/533556271/senate-democrats-stage-stand-off-over-gop-health-care-efforts

item.title: A Good News Story About Diarrhea â€” With One Surprising Exception
item.description: June 19, 2017 - A new report points to great progress in reducing deaths from diarrheal diseases. But as the low-income world sees progress, rates are inching up in wealthy countries, including the U.S.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - A new report points to great progress in reducing deaths from diarrheal diseases. But as the low-income world sees progress, rates are inching up in wealthy countries, including the U.S. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/19/531912971/a-good-news-story-about-diarrhea-with-one-surprising-exception

item.title: A Couple's Quest To Stop A Rare Disease Before It Takes One Of Them
item.description: June 19, 2017 - Twenty years. That's how long two grad students, Sonia Vallabh and Eric Minikel, think they have before a deadly disease envelops Sonia's brain. The Massachusetts couple is now racing to find a cure.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - Twenty years. That's how long two grad students, Sonia Vallabh and Eric Minikel, think they have before a deadly disease envelops Sonia's brain. The Massachusetts couple is now racing to find a cure. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/19/527795512/a-couples-quest-to-stop-a-rare-disease-before-it-takes-one-of-them

item.title: Can You Find The Defibrillator At Work? Half Of People Say No
item.description: June 19, 2017 - People who work in the hospitality and service industries were even less likely to know where to find an AED, according to a new survey. The devices can restart someone's heart after cardiac arrest.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - People who work in the hospitality and service industries were even less likely to know where to find an AED, according to a new survey. The devices can restart someone's heart after cardiac arrest. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/19/533269211/can-you-find-the-defibrillator-at-work-half-of-people-say-no

item.title: Over Objections, Italy Introduces Tough Vaccination Measure
item.description: June 19, 2017 - In Italy, parents who don't vaccinate their children face steep fines, and even risk losing custody. It's in response to a measles outbreak, after years of falling inoculation rates.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - In Italy, parents who don't vaccinate their children face steep fines, and even risk losing custody. It's in response to a measles outbreak, after years of falling inoculation rates. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/19/533481635/over-objections-italy-introduces-tough-vaccination-measure

item.title: A Mother's Early Death Drives Her Daughter To Find A Treatment
item.description: June 19, 2017 - Sonia Vallabh knows that by the time she's middle-aged, a rare inherited disease will likely start killing off her brain cells. She and her husband have become scientists to try to stop the disease.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - Sonia Vallabh knows that by the time she's middle-aged, a rare inherited disease will likely start killing off her brain cells. She and her husband have become scientists to try to stop the disease. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/19/533220784/a-mothers-early-death-drives-her-daughter-to-find-a-treatment

item.title: When Medical Bills Stack Up, Many Turn To Crowdsourcing Sites
item.description: June 18, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro speaks with Lauren Carman, who used crowdsourcing to help pay medical expenses from breast cancer and delivering premature twins.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 18, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro speaks with Lauren Carman, who used crowdsourcing to help pay medical expenses from breast cancer and delivering premature twins. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/18/533402814/when-medical-bills-stack-up-many-turn-to-crowdsourcing-sites

item.title: This Father's Day, Remembering A Time When Dads Weren't Welcome In Delivery Rooms
item.description: June 18, 2017 - For many fathers, the birth of a child is a hugely emotional moment. But not that long ago, few fathers were allowed to participate in the process.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 18, 2017 - For many fathers, the birth of a child is a hugely emotional moment. But not that long ago, few fathers were allowed to participate in the process. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/18/532921305/this-fathers-day-remembering-a-time-when-dads-werent-welcome-in-delivery-rooms

item.title: Alzheimer's Starts To Steal The Joy Of Being A Grandfather
item.description: June 17, 2017 - When Greg O'Brien found out he'd be a grandfather, he was excited. He was also sad. His granddaughter, he knew, would never know the real him.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 17, 2017 - When Greg O'Brien found out he'd be a grandfather, he was excited. He was also sad. His granddaughter, he knew, would never know the real him. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/17/528636102/alzheimer-s-starts-to-steal-the-joy-of-being-a-grandfather

item.title: Heartbeat Music: Parents Remember Their Son Through His Song Of Life
item.description: June 16, 2017 - Nate Kramer was a tall, quiet collegiate swimmer when he was diagnosed with leukemia. He died four years later. But during treatment he met a therapist, and together they played and recorded music.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - Nate Kramer was a tall, quiet collegiate swimmer when he was diagnosed with leukemia. He died four years later. But during treatment he met a therapist, and together they played and recorded music. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/16/533255537/heartbeat-music-parents-remember-their-son-through-his-song-of-life
